Key Match Events: The Wolves trailed by 19 in the first half.
Minnesota shot just 41 percent from the field and 31 percent from deep.
Edwards scored 27 points, but required 25 shots to do so.
Randle struggled for much of the game.
Mike Conley had no impact in his 20 minutes.
Jaden McDaniels was limited to just 16 minutes of action as he battled foul trouble.
Pre-Game Insights: Any concerns anyone may have had about the Wolves heading into the season were re-enforced with Tuesday’s performance.
It’s a good bet the Wolves will figure things out in short order this time around, as well.
Post-Match Reflections: “There was a lot going on in the game plan tonight, maybe too much at times,” Timberwolves coach Chris Finch said. “We might have to simplify some things early, here. But I didn’t see a lot of resistance. Even when we had an opportunity to contain, we didn’t do a good job of that early on.”
“Obviously, we had a ton of turnovers,” Finch said. “Those turnovers were mostly a result of trying to do everything 1 on 5.”
“We’ve got to find another level of urgency,” Finch said. “The season started, and we didn’t answer the bell.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Davis looked like the best player on the floor at both ends, with his motor putting Minnesota to shame. He finished with 36 points, 16 rebounds and three blocked shots.
The Lakers ended up with fastbreak layups fresh off Minnesota made buckets.
Others: The 2023-24 Timberwolves made the opponent earn everything with their harassing defense that never gave even an inch.
